snippet: Contradictory accounts from Pakistan and Saudi Arabia raise questions about where Ms. Malik, a suspect in the San Bernardino shootings, was raised.
abstract: Contradictory claims by Pakistan and Saudi Arabia about background of Tashfeen Malik, suspect in San Bernardino, Calif mass shooting, complicate effort to determine where she may have been radicalized; Saudi officials deny Malik spent significant time there, despite strong evidence to contrary; both countries hope to avoid further complicating their relationships with United States.

byline.contributor: Salman Masood contributed reporting from Multan, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Contradictory accounts from Pakistan and Saudi Arabia raise questions about where Ms. Malik, a suspect in the San Bernardino shootings, was raised.

headline.main: Discrepancies Emerge Over Where Tashfeen Malik Grew Up
headline.print_headline: Officials in Saudi Arabia Contradict Accounts That Female Assailant Grew Up There
